page.title: 05JERSEY LANE:ST.ALBANS
page.content: As we walked along Jersey Lane we noticed all the wildlife. We saw green finches, wrens, gold finches, grey squirrels and we even spotted some frogs. It was exciting to go through the bushes; to look and listen to all the different things around us. As we walked further along the path we noticed that there were fewer trees and shrubs on one side of the lane. We soon saw why. New houses were being built and all the wildlife seemed to be in great danger. There were lots of houses being built and they took up a lot of room. Although there were trees on one side of the lane the birds and wildlife were in great danger. The beautiful countryside was being threatened just to build more houses.
